intro: Allardia vestita, commonly known as the naked allardia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Allardia vestita thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
